intro: Gomesa binotii, commonly known as the two-spotted gomesia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Gomesa binotii is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
